intro: Austroeupatorium paulinum, commonly known as the Florida ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant features tall, slender stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, often with a distinct scent. Austroeupatorium paulinum plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
